data.title: Not what I was hoping for
data.text: There's character here and the menu had a good variety. We went on a holiday morning, was busy so had to wait about 20 min, no big deal, she had warned us. The girl who greeted us was very nice, but our server basically ignored us after taking our order. She did apologize for not paying attention to us when she brought our bill after we had to ask for it, but she never asked how our meal was, if we wanted anything else, the basics you ask. I'm very picky, but my husband is not. I had the ham/cheese omlet, it was ok. It had pepper in it and I didn't care for it, but it wasn't very big, in fact I finished it (which I never do) and was hungry when we left. My hubby had the eggs bene and he said they were fine, but nothing fantastic. Their prices are decent for what you get and the people watching is great as it's located right downtown. It's family friendly, even having coloring books and crayons. I've lived here all my life so had to try it, but I don't think i'll be back, there are other places to try.

data.title: More than a Little Cheerful
data.text: Travelling thru. My hotel only had breakfast till 9. 😥 I'm not an early riser. Lucky me. I found Little Cheerful instead. I'm a veggie trying to keep carbs low: a challenge on the road. Not so at Little Cheerful. Plenty of good chouces. Delicious breakfast. Very nice atmosphere. One of the staff singing softly to the music. Sun streaming in. Happineess for an hour.

data.title: Still an amazing breakfast after all these years.
data.text:
Went to school at WWU back in the 90s, this was a common breakfast place back then, lots of fond memories. Was recently on a road trip with my family, we stopped here for breakfast, yummm. 
The food was great. I had the corn beef hash, was made with real corn beef and a lot of it. Everyone raves about the food. On the slightly high price, but was also very good and large portions. 
Would have given them a 5 star, but the coffee was terrible, sorry, but it's true, and coffee is an integral part of a breakfast joint, however, will not stop me from coming back, when ever in town or passing through.

data.title: Love me some funk and great food.
data.text: Worth the waiting as you can people observe and the food is different and yummy. I ordered a special in a skillet and kept saying I had enough half way thru and then ate the whole thing it was so good.

data.title: One of the best breakfasts in town!
data.text: You may have to wait on a weekend morning, but it will be worth it.  Full breakfast menu, almost anything you could want.  Great coffee.  Smoked salmon benedict is not to be missed.

data.title: Reliable diner for breakfast and lunch
data.text: Kind of a banged up place on a banged up corner of downtown.  Only open until 2pm, so late lunch is a no-go... but they serve up a big and delicious breakfast at any time while open.... and mine was really good.  Totally casual, but prompt and friendly service with nice portions of good food.  I can see why people like the place.

data.title: No wonder it is rated highly!
data.text: Very casual & very friendly. They put nice little twists on the traditional and it fun ways. If you aren't a foodie but just like good food around a good vibe you will fit in fine here.

data.title: yikes
data.text: ordered the pancakes, dry and grainy, honestly the worst I've eaten. Will not be returning. The coffee was alright, but waited for an excessive amount of time (40+ minutes) considering that pancakes and coffee were all that I had ordered.

data.title: great breakfast spot
data.text: We went here on a friend's advice. We had brunch outside on a Sunday AM. They are dog friendly on the patio. The coffee was great. The fruit platter was wonderful. Crab benny is a YES. the breakfast sandwich (McStupid?? or something) was tasty. The service was friendly.

data.title: Loved the biscuits and gravy meal
data.text: Visited today after a recommend from a local resident.  We were greeted and seated on arrival, brought water and asked if we wanted coffee which was brought to us right away.  I asked if the sausage gravy was good and the server offered to bring a sample to taste and brought a small bowl of it out!  One taste and I wanted the biscuit and gravy breakfast which included hash browns and 2 eggs.  She ordered the French toast which was made with wheat bread and included fresh fruit - all sliced, watermelon, pink grapefruit, cantaloupe, pineapple, and a single strawberry.  She enjoyed and ate all her toast, a lot of the fruit and shared the rest with me.  The sausage gravy and biscuits were perfect to my taste and I gobbled it down.  Unfortunately, after the eggs, too, I was too full to eat all my hash browns which were mixed crispy all through - very good.  They slice the hash browns themselves (not frozen from a bag), bake their own biscuits, and make their own gravy.  Our server kept the coffee cups topped off perfectly and with a smile.  Oh, and they bring a little pitcher of half & half to the table with your coffee!  We enjoyed this place and will be back while we're visiting.  Breakfast and coffee was just over $24 plus tip.  One note to new visitors:  They only take cash or checks, but have an ATM machine inside by the door.

data.title: Delicious Hashbrowns!
data.text: The place is small but the servings are huge.  Wonderful food and staff.  There were three in our party, everyone ordered something different and they all were delicious.  Love the location -- nice to look out and see the Bellingham sites.

data.title: Another delicious meal at Little Cheerful
data.text: We make a point of eating at the Little Cheerful whenever we're in the Bellingham area and are always pleased when we leave. It's a funky little spot with friendly staff, a slightly quirky menu and good food for a reasonable price. That's a winning combination to our minds (and tummies) that will keep us coming back.

data.title: Good- but the pimps can be pricey
data.text: Love this little gem.  They specialize in "pimping" your foods with a little extra something.   The potatoes are hashbrowns with your favorite add on's.  Our party of 6 enjoyed pancakes, with chocolate chips and blueberries, omelets, eggs benedict and cheesy bacon potatoes.  All was well until we rec'd the check.   I would recommend splitting meals as the portions are plentiful and be mindful that there is an automatic gratuity on parties 6 or more.   Also be mindful of the add on's as they add up. I would not expect breakfast for 6 to cost just as much as a nice dinner for 6.  Next time (and there will be one) I'll do this differently.  It's a pick!

data.title: Great place
data.text: Went there for breakfast this week end. Great staff, great service and great food! Small little funky place with all walks of life there. Nothing more to say other than you will not be disappointed . FYI, come early as the place gets very busy .

data.title: Breakfast
data.text:
I stopped in because as a foodie who loves GOOD real food, I read the hash browns were supposed to be wonderful....NOT!

I ordered the bacon and cheese hash browns with eggs over medium. If you like over salted...very overcooked and dark hash browns (and a plate of grease!) go there! 

The eggs were done correctly and there was a good amount of bacon and onions in the hash browns but hash browns were over salted (and I like salt!), and dark brown and greasy! It wasn't worth all the hype, as a foodie who wants quality food, I had to give it a lower rating. The so called homemade biscuits were just barely okay. For REAL high quality and super homemade biscuits to die for,  I go back to rock and Rye Oyster House on State for their weekend brunch! Wish they served breakfast everyday!

data.title: Good food but not great if there is a long wait
data.text: We came in a Sunday and had expected a long wait and were pleasant surprised that it only took 5 minutes to get a table. We ordered the specials and then waited a long time for food but the waitress kept the coffee full. The food was good but not the best diner breakfast we have ever had and the portion sizes were so large they were almost bordering on gross. Interesting and tasty specials.

data.title: Fun and Good Food
data.text: Fun little café with cheerful people, good food, and reasonable prices. Local artwork on the walls, and fortune cookies at the cash register. Good wine, too!

data.title: Fun, cheerful, & good
data.text:
I met a friend here when driving thru the area a few days ago and really enjoyed it. 

I had the 'bacon & cheddar' hash browns and coffee. Everything was really good. Good food and good service. I'll return the nect time I'm passing thru.

data.title: Fun place to meet
data.text: Our family all met here for breakfast.  Great food. They give everything a little twist from normal. Which makes it excellent.  Love sitting outside on the patio. Eating, visiting, and watching the crowd go by

data.title: Good food
data.text:
Friendly staff, cute little spot. We got in early morning but as we were eating this place filled up fast! Line waiting out the door. Seating is limited. They have very interesting decor all over lol. You'll just have to see it, we got a kick out of it all. 
I really enjoyed the ham eggs Benedict and hash while my boyfriend got the small order of pancakes; which was huge! 
This place only takes cash or check. Atm on site.
